result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore A Harkness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: STRAIGHT TIME, with credit for 7 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 07/25/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply and any remainder to be returned to whoever posted it.

- No contact with DGF.
- No driving without a valid drivers license or proof of insurance.

- Mental health assessment & any recommended treatment.
- Anger management class.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore A Harkness

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore A Harkness in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Court orders the 07/25/2022 jury trial vacated.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, with credit for 7 days time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 12 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- no contact with DGF
- mental health assessment & any recommended treatment
- no driving without a valid drivers license or proof of insurance
- AODA assessment and recommended treatment
- anger management class

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, 07/25/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply and any remainder to be returned to whoever posted it. 

Appeal rights given.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
